organization.name: Community Mutual Aid Network
organization.mission: Build community resilience through horizontal resource sharing, ensuring no one faces hardship alone.

environment.content: Resource scarcity in our community is primarily a distribution problem, not a supply problem.
Existing social safety nets have significant gaps that leave many community members unsupported.
environment.source: Service gap analysis and member intake data

environment.content: Communities possess untapped resilience and capacity for self-organization when given tools and trust.
environment.source: Disaster response outcomes and mutual aid literature

environment.content: Systemic barriers including racism, ableism, and economic inequality create disproportionate need in marginalized communities.
environment.source: Disaggregated community data and lived experience

capabilities.content: Our volunteer network can mobilize within 24 hours for urgent needs.
capabilities.source: Response time logs from past 12 months

capabilities.content: We have strong relationships with local food banks, shelters, and healthcare providers.

values.content: Equitable distribution of resources based on need, not merit or means-testing.
Community empowerment and self-determination in all decision-making.
Solidarity over charity -- we help each other, not help 'them'.
Radical transparency in all operations and resource allocation.
Accessibility and inclusion for disabled, elderly, undocumented, and unhoused community members.

mission_targets.content: Fulfill 90% of submitted resource requests within 72 hours.
Grow active volunteer base by 25% year-over-year.
Establish mutual aid pods in every neighborhood within service area.

active_strategies.content: Build a resource matching system that connects needs with offers in real time.
Develop multilingual intake process to reduce language barriers.
Create a community fridge and pantry network across three neighborhoods.

campaigns.content: Winter preparedness drive: collect and distribute cold weather supplies.
Know Your Rights workshops for tenants facing eviction.

grants.content: Apply for community foundation rapid-response grant for emergency supplies.

principles.equity_mandate: Resources are distributed based on need. We do not means-test. We actively prioritize those most marginalized by systemic oppression.
principles.data_sovereignty: All community member data belongs to the community. Data is never sold, shared with law enforcement, or used for purposes beyond direct mutual aid without explicit consent.
principles.community_accountability: All major decisions are made by general assembly. Kintsugi actions affecting community members require community input through established consensus processes.

custom.name: No means-testing
custom.description: We never require proof of income, immigration status, or other qualifying criteria to provide aid.

custom.name: Horizontal governance
custom.description: No permanent hierarchies. Roles rotate. Leadership is distributed and accountable.

custom.name: No law enforcement collaboration
custom.description: We do not share data with or refer to law enforcement agencies under any circumstances.

custom.name: Mutual respect
custom.description: Every interaction honors the dignity and autonomy of community members.
